title: I Dreamed Your Dream For You and Now My Nightmare is Real
description: two broken-apart, swirling, irregular, stepped base-like forms at angles; top central figure with human body and arms and hoofed legs, with a growling bear\'s head; irregular forms with circular patterns on main figure\'s back, beneath figure\'s feet and on right portion of \"base,\" with tiny arms protruding from inside of forms; white porcelain figure slots in and fits around gilt stoneware organic-form base section
creditline: Gift of funds from Tamara and Michael Root
